title: Light Ethereum Peer connection issues
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 
```
Geth
Version: 1.10.5-stable
Git Commit: 33ca98ece985f5085ac8ec19a49239d726850004
Git Commit Date: 20210714
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.16.6
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=go
```

#### Expected behaviour

P2P-LES should work correctly.

#### Actual behaviour

Disconnects (after?) handshake.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

* Start one light-node & one full-node.
* Add the `enode:// (without @host:port)` of the light-node to the `TrustedNodes` config of the Ethereum full-node.
* Add `enode:// (with @host:port)` of the full-node to the `StaticNodes` config of the Ethereum light-node.

**Maybe relevant: use ListenAddr = ":5000"**

Restarting both and send `eth_getLogs` to the light-node. Connection errors are starting to happen.

#### Backtrace

````
2021-07-19T11:20:15.232175498Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.228] Adding p2p peer                          peercount=4 id=78d1bbff0298be05 conn=staticdial            addr=[fdaa:0:13ca:a7b:67:0:2ad8:2]:5000 name=Geth/v1.10.5-stable-...
2021-07-19T11:20:15.234953328Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.232] Light Ethereum peer connected            id=78d1bbff0298be05 conn=staticdial            name=Geth/v1.10.5-stable-...
2021-07-19T11:20:15.292356681Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.290] Node entered                             set=connected  id=78d1bbff0298be05 count=4
2021-07-19T11:20:15.294854633Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.292] Relaxed msgrate QoS values               proto=eth rtt=20s confidence=0.100 ttl=1m0s
2021-07-19T11:20:15.297585114Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.295] Received new announce                    peer=78d1bbff0298be05 number=12,856,699 hash=0d5f73..010e56 reorg=0
2021-07-19T11:20:15.300195815Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.297] Light Ethereum message handling failed   id=78d1bbff0298be05 conn=staticdial            err=EOF
2021-07-19T11:20:15.301125809Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.298] Saved node state                         id=78d1bbff0298be05 state=[hasValue]
2021-07-19T11:20:15.302140912Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.298] Node left                                set=connected  id=78d1bbff0298be05 count=3
2021-07-19T11:20:15.303425782Z app[3d9c5466] fra [info] DEBUG[07-19|11:20:15.298] Removing p2p peer                        peercount=3 id=78d1bbff0298be05 duration=70.838ms  req=true err="disconnect requested"
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.
Are you sure your LES server is synced? I can't reproduce your issue. Do you have any logs from the LES server side?

The problem is the following:
full-node: trusted-node with light-peer
light-peer: static-node with full-node

Most of times the first one or two requests are served from the full-node before `Light Ethereum message handling failed`.
And sometimes, it immediately throws a handshake error. Pretty likely due to async networking behaviour.

I fixed the connection errors by:
full-node: trusted-node with light-peer (as above)
light-peer: trusted-node & static-node entry for full-node (fixes the connection problems)

There are different branches across the relevant handlers for `p.trusted` nodes - might be a good target. though, I did not a deep dive into the codebase 🙂

Trusted-node means that the peer is always accepted even if there is no more connection slot. Static-node means that the peer will always be dialed if it's not connected. Not sure why it's relevant with your node.  

But look at the log, it's indeed weird. Looks like the tcp connection is closed somehow after the handshake.
